intro: Microphytanthe prorepens, commonly known as the creeping microphytanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and linear leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its growth habit is prostrate, allowing it to spread along the ground and form dense mats. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
